field.label: Name
field.help: The name of the virtual server.

field.label: Enable
field.help: If unchecked start the virtual server disabled.

field.label: Server Type
field.help:
Redirections
   Redirections are translated to pf(4) rdr-to rules for stateful
   forwarding to a target host from a health-checked table on layer 3.

Relays
   Relays allow application layer load balancing, SSL acceleration,
   and general purpose TCP proxying on layer 7.

field.label: Listen Address
field.help: Specify an address to listen on.

field.label: Listen IP Protocol
field.help: Specify an IP protocol for the listener.

field.label: Listen Port
field.help: Specify the port to listen on.

field.label: Listen End Port
field.help: Specify the end of a port range.

field.label: Interface
field.help: The Interface to listen on. Leave it unset to listen on all interfaces.

field.label: Transport Type
field.help: Forward or Route packets to the backend hosts.

field.label: Routing Interface
field.help: The interface to use for routing packages.

field.label: Table
field.help: Specify the table of target hosts to be used.

field.label: Port
field.help: Specify the destination port.

field.label: Check Interval
field.help: Override the global interval. I must be a multiple of the global interval.

field.label: Check Timeout
field.help: Override the global check timeout.

field.label: Scheduler
field.help: Set the scheduling algorithm to select a host from the table.

field.label: Table Check
field.help: Specify the table check.

field.label: Backup Table
field.help: Specify the table of target hosts to be used.

field.label: Backup Check Interval
field.help: Override the global interval. I must be a multiple of the global interval.

field.label: Backup Check Timeout
field.help: Override the global check timeout.

field.label: Backup Table Scheduler
field.help: Set the scheduling algorithm to select a host from the table.

field.label: Backup Table Check
field.help: Specify the table check.

field.label: Session Timeout
field.help:
Specify the inactivity timeout in seconds for established
redirections. The default timeout is 600 seconds (10 minutes).
The maximum is 2147483647 seconds (68 years).

field.label: Sticky Address
field.help:
It will ensure that multiple connections
from the same source are mapped to the same redirection address.

field.label: Protocol
field.help: Use the specified protocol definition for the relay.
